etymology.description: 尹(尹) (yǐn, "govern") + 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") = vocal commands or governance -> sovereign
etymology.interpretation: 君(jūn, "sovereign") combines 尹(尹) (yǐn, "govern") as the phonetic component with 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") to suggest the concept of one who issues commands vocally, hence representing a 'sovereign'. The character emphasizes the authoritative voice of a ruler.

examples.english: A virtuous sovereign loves his people.

examples.chinese: 仁君施恩于国(仁君施恩於國)，君子仰之待之(君子仰之待之)。
examples.pinyin: Rén jūn shī ēn yú guó, jūn zǐ yǎng zhī dài zhī.
examples.english: A benevolent sovereign bestows his grace upon his country, and gentlemen look up to him.

examples.chinese: 明君察世事(明君察世事)，治国安民(治國安民)。
examples.pinyin: Míng jūn chá shìshì, zhì guó ān mín.
examples.english: A wise sovereign observes worldly affairs, governing the state and ensuring peace among the people.
